title: Why is "I" the symbol of God? The importance of numbers and letters in Dante's numerology and Pitagora's philosophy.
first_phrase: In the last part of this text, the author discusses the importance of the letter "I" in different cultures and its association with the concept of God. The text mentions the opinions of various scholars and writers, such as Francesco da Barberino and Ubertino da Casale, about the significance of "I" in the nomen Domini. The author also explores how Dante used different letters in his computations and gave importance to their numerical values. Before this, the text describes the significance of the number "1" and its association with God, as observed in different cultures, including the philosophy of Pitagora six hundred years before Christ.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the importance of numbers and their mystic symbolism has been recognized by many cultures throughout history, from the emphasis on the number 7 in mathematics to the adoration of the divine tetractys by the Pitagorici.
